page.title: 07EMPLOYMENT IN HARWICH
page.content: IN THE 1950s THERE WERE ONLY 28 UNEMPLOYED IN HARWICH ; TODAY THERE ARE 1012 (12.4%). THERE WERE 650 JOB VACANCIES IN THE JOB CENTRE LAST YEAR ALTOGETHER, BUT ONLY 600 WERE FILLED. OUT OF THE 600 WHO WERE FIXED UP, THERE WERE ONLY 100 SCHOOL LEAVERS EMPLOYED.THERE ARE ABOUT 500 THERE ARE OVER 500 PEOPLE EMPLOYED BY TRINITY HOUSE AND THERE ARE 700 SHOP WORKERS CURRENTLY EMPLOYED IN FOOD SHOPS etc. 300 PEOPLE HAVE BEEN EMPLOYED ON BUILDING SITES, AND THERE ARE OVER 1000 WHO ARE EMPLOYED IN FACTORIES. THE HARDEST PART OF THE JOB CENTRE'S WORK IS BEING FAIR TO EVERY TYPE OF JOB SEEKER, SEEING AN AVERAGE NUMBER OF 40 PEOPLE A DAY. THE MOST UNUSUAL JOB VACANCIES WERE FOR A TOPLESS WAITRESS AND A BELLY DANCER.
